But come on in after a sox game and you'll see a staff that works a grill quickly and you can have breakfast/lunch/diner 24 hours a day!The burgers are awesome as it's a rarity to find a hand patted burger. It may cost a little more then a whopper or a big mac. But hey...do you want a frozen with sub-par ingredients. OR DO YOU WANT A FRESH MEAT BURGER!!! Come on in....and dig in!

27.description: This is a strange "four star"er for me. This place is an old school truck stop, right here in Chicago. They have $5.99 T-bone steaks to prove it too. Not that I would recommenda $5.99 T-bone to anyone. Nope the only thing I recommend is the burger. Quite possibly the best "old school" burger in the whole city. And by old school I mean fatty (as opposed to lean) ground beef fried on a griddle rather than charred on a grill, piles of mayo, american cheese and wonder bread buns. These are the burgers our parents ate at roller skate drive ins. These are the burgers that our grandparents fought the Nazi's in order to defend. Cause if you've ever had a German burger, it ain't nothin' like this....However, this place really is a 24-hour truck stop, and even in broad daylight there are some rough and tough clientele there. I'm also told that there is an armed security guard there at night. So if you want to try the burger that your grandfather fought for, be prepared to fight for it yourself. And stay away from the T-bone....

0.description: Kevin is my only go to spot for breakfast. When I first started going here, the waitresses would have me dying of laughter from their sassiness and sarcasm. Kind of ended or rather subsided. But these ladies are REAL Chicagoans. Now, I go because they make a KICK A$$$ breakfast.

20.description: Love love love their steak, egg, and pancake breakfast!! My boyfriend introduced me to this crappy looking dive 2 years ago and we dont go there often but when we decide to its a big treat! I've only had the food I mentioned above and I dont think I NEED to try anything else just to tell you that I love their food. The steak is super tender, well seasoned, and they give you loads of A-1 sauce to dress it. The pancakes are fluffy and delicious, and the eggs are lovely.Overall...I wouldnt be seen in this joint for long periods of time (ate there once and decided that carry-out was my best bet) but man...just try their steak & eggs breakfast. Keep the car running...LOL.

19.description: What a joke this place was. I ordered a simple ham and cheese sandwich. Not only did it take 10 minutes, it also didn't have cheese on it. It was very expensive for the location, and the menu didn't have prices on it.

2.description: I live practically within spitting distance of this old truck stop diner, and it definitely has its good and bad moments. During the day, Kevin's is a nice place to grab breakfast and coffee. The staff is generally nice and knows the area well. At night, this place is a hell hole. All orders have to be pre-paid from 9 PM to 5 AM, and they had to install bulletproof glass and a revolving window around the diner counter recently because of the horrible patrons at night. Every weekend there is a fight, and every couple of months there is a shooting or armed robbery. Owners of Kevin's, you've got a great place and I appreciate the armed security at night. But this neighborhood would patronize your diner a LOT more if you just closed for the night, especially after 12 AM. The clientele that emerges from Fuller Park and the projects ruins it for me, and I don't feel safe coming here any more, as I'm sure others in the area feel.

18.description: Yes, Kevins is a %*%^* Dive.  Don't go there looking for fancy place settings or clean silverware :) I have never had a Kevins burger, I only go for their breakfast, the steak, potatoes and pancakes are bananas!! Not only do they taste great but they are super cheap.  Although it's NOT the CLEANEST place in the best neighborhood, the food, and prices are worth the risks.  Its a popular late night spot, with the after nightclub crowd and you may encounter the loud, aggressive types, so if that scares you, go during the midday.  Breakfast for 2 is never more than 15 bucks.  Kevins I "heart" you.

13.description: I was jonesing extra mightily for a cheeseburger - nothing else would do.  I got the cheeseburger, complete with grilled onions, pickles, other decently non-lethal stuff, a shitty booth, one of the best milkshakes I've ever met, a fucking insane waitress (who I hugged before leaving), and extra grease.Holy God Damn, it was good.

24.description: This joint ain't too shabby. My brother took me to Kevin's on Saturday so I could try their "One of a kind" burger. It was pretty tasty. Seasoned with what I think was Lawry's Seasoning Salt, cooked just right and topped with lettuce, onion and tomato and of course I added cheese. Probably not the best burger I've ever had but at that price it can't be beat. I can't say I would go out of my way to come here but if in the area I would definitely stop in again. Oh and the counter staff was very entertainng and only added to that gruff diner feel.

6.description: White trash is in the house place has my Catholic lent Friday breakfast just hoping I don't get shot

22.description: Why do people say this burger is so delicious?  It was fatty and on the thin side for my liking.  However it was well seasoned.  I liked the fact that I could order it on rye bread instead of a bun, but it was nothing special.  Although we were clearly out of place, the counter staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome.  They got an extra star for being so patient with patrons who couldn't figure out the side options with their breakfast plates.

15.description: Good and cheap. Nothing exceptional but everything is edible with no complaints from me. I liked the chocolate shake. It is probably the best dive diner I have been to in Chicago thus far. Kinda shady, yeah there is bootlegged DVD and CD sales but nothing scary.

7.description: Overpriced Bridgeport DinnerI mainly only go for there coffee with cream and sugar. It's delicious and you don't have to add anything extra cream or sugar. It's perfect coffee to me even though I'm no coffee specialist. But the food is ridiculously over priced. You can easily order two cheese burgers and fries and pay $20. They charge for extra everything. Just stick with the coffee.

8.description: just did take out & i appreciate when the food is ready when i get there. always tasty & affordable!

3.description: Restaurant is located in a very crummy neighborhood- would not walk around alone at night. However the staff was very welcoming and the food was decent for the money. There are many better burger places in Chicago but this place feels very welcoming. Fries were below average. Would recommend .

14.description: Love love love their steak, egg, and pancake breakfast!! My boyfriend introduced me to this crappy looking dive 2 years ago and we dont go there often but when we decide to its a big treat! I've only had the food I mentioned above and I dont think I NEED to try anything else just to tell you that I love their food. The steak is super tender, well seasoned, and they give you loads of A-1 sauce to dress it. The pancakes are fluffy and delicious, and the eggs are lovely.Overall...I wouldnt be seen in this joint for long periods of time (ate there once and decided that carry-out was my best bet) but man...just try their steak & eggs breakfast. Keep the car running...LOL.

1.description: i was walking back to my car after going here recently on a hot day and i noticed 3 kids (i'd guesstimate 6 years old-ish) left in the backseat of a parked car next to mine. the windows were let down only slightly, i assume for air flow or whatever; parents no where to be found. they were looking at me so i smiled and waved at them to be friendly. one kid said to me, "yo babe lemme suck on yo titties". IM NOT SHITTING YOU. i can't believe the vocabulary of someone that young could be so brash! perhaps it has something to do with the absence of parenting!some days the cashiers are really nice to me. other days it's as if i am a ghost - and i feel it may partly have to do with me being white as a ghost. same goes for the other patrons. i've had friendly conversations with some folks while i've been shoved by others when being passed in an aisle. you never know what level of ignorance you will be dealing with in a day. it won't stop me from coming here yet, but it's a force to be contended with!it is right next to my local grocery store so i strolled in my first time curious to see what would be the best way to spend a dollar. now i come here once or twice a month. i typically get here:1) large garbage bags - varying quantities for $1, $3, or $5.... for 50-75% less than i'd typically pay2) toilet paper - a bit cheaper for the quality stuff but not jaw dropping cheap. qualities, quantities and prices vary so you can get a crappy 4-pk for $1 or a lil better for a lil more.3) reusable water bottles - ive got 3 different shapes and sizes for everyone in my household... 64 oz for the daily drinking, 32 oz for when going to the gym, 20 oz for smoothies/shakers which even has a filter all for $1 to $3 dollars each.4) cheap scented candles for $1. i light candles all the time around the house. i go through em fast so it's good to have some cheaper ones around for everyday aromas. besides i save the glasses when done for crafts.5) dishwasher pellets - a big box full of em. the same brand i get at Dominicks or Fairplay for a hellava lot cheaper.6) cleaning items - cheap mops, sponges, washcloths... sometimes even soaps and cleanersi'd like to see this place turnaround. but it takes a community to do that. i am sure i am not the only one waiting for the day they didn't have to loop the intercom message that we are being watched, keep all items of interest visible, and that there is a team of guards waiting to crack down on theft. REALLY? theft at a dollar store is a real LOW.

0.description: I've been to a few Family Dollar Stores since I moved to Chicago, and I frankly just don't care for the places.  Some of them are at least decent and cleaned-up and respectable in appearance, but this location was a bit shabbier than most I've been to.My first inkling that this isn't the best Family Dollar out there was when I couldn't get in because one of the employees was shouting halfway down the parking lot to someone she knew.  Could have been a co-worker or a friend, but all I know is that she chose to have the conversation while leaning out the open door and yelling, blocking the entrance and annoying me with her shrill screeching voice.  She noticed me standing there after 20 seconds and said, "you coming in?"  I nodded, but rather than leave the doorway, she squeezed two inches closer to the door frame and I had to pretty much push my way in-between just to attempt to be their customer.I sadly remained in the "not their customer" category at the end of it, since he only things that I was tempted to buy either 1) had no price tag in sight or 2) were just as expensive (if not more) than I could get at a more reputable store.That's what I don't get about "Family Dollar Store".  It's not like Dollar Tree where almost everything is $1.  It's not even like all things are priced to the dollar, since about 40% of the items have cents involved.  And 60% may be a majority, but it's not enough to consider yourself a dollar-based store.I can understand that the title may be implying that you can "stretch your dollar" to get what you need "for your family" - but if it's not a generic/FDS brand, you're usually paying pull price anyway.  At least that's the impression I got from this store in particular.

28.description: I've had birthday cakes from Bake from Me that were fantastic.   Really good cake.  Then I've had their coffee cakes and breads which are not very impressive.  The bread does not taste like bakery bread.  It's more like bread made in a bread factory.   It's just ok.  Their coffee cakes are bland and not very good.  It's llike they are from 2 different bakeries.

1.description: This is a great local bakery. They have a large assortment of pastries to choose from. During my visit I ordered a small coffee and apple fritter which was delicious. I purchased my items with my debit card. I was told that I need to purchase $5 minimum to use my card. My two items were a grand total of $2.24. I did not want to purchase anything else so the cashier offered to charge my card for $5. I was given the reminder of my change from $5. My main reason for stopping by the bakery on this particular day was the Paczki. Unfortunately for me they did not have any fresh Paczki in stock.

9.description: Great veggie sandwich, all the pastries I've tried are good.  Coffee nothing special, and Styrofoam cupped - real espresso machine though.  Lots of things for a nice quick lunch.  Nice outdoor patio and plenty of parking for cars and bikes.  Good service and the custom cakes look amazing.  Prices reasonable especially if ya can do with extra discounted day old.  4 stars for coffee and Styrofoam which is big deal to me,  everything else 5 or more :-)

29.description: We came for breakfast & I ordered a sandwich, which was just ok. I think their baked goods are supposed to be better. However, I heard that their cake is affordable & beautifully made.

23.description: I go to Bake for Me at least once or twice a week for lunch. Can't speak to the bakery side of things, but definitely a solid lunch at extremely reasonable prices. The soups are all homemade and I particularly like the chicken salad and meat chili. As there are really only a handful of lunch spots in the stockyards area, you may find yourself fighting for a seat, especially in winter when the few outdoor tables are unavailable. I wouldn't go out of your way, but a good choice if you find yourself nearby.

5.description: Happened upon this bakery and stopped in for lunch. I was pleasantly surprised about how delicious the Turkey club was and the fresh bread. I also had the carrot cake slice which was great but the frosting is okay, the cinnamon roll was much better. Overall great little hidden gem.

31.description: I love having a bakery with great coffee in the south side (Canaryville neighborhood)!  Finally!  Canaryville definitely needs a place like this.  I've had the cheese croissant, and a cheese/cherry danish from there, as well as a cup of coffee.  Sooooo good!The people that work there are really nice and helpful.  One time when I went there, they gave me a free box of bite sized pastries along with my order.  Yay, free food!  I have been to the establishment a few times since then, and I plan on being a loyal customer.

25.description: Made our wedding cake exactally as my bridge wanted.  It was elegant, delicious and beyond well priced.  Thanks you Bake for Me!

12.description: We have a donut rotation at my job and I've been trekking to a really good bakery *kind of* on the way to work.  Have been afraid to try a different bakery because my usual gets really good reviews... but BFM is 4 blocks from my house!  Decided today was the day I'd risk a new bakery.  Boy am I glad I risked it (the women at my job are scary about their Friday donuts!!!) These donuts were Delicious!!! And huge!  Same exact price as other bakery, much bigger, and I'd say much better!  I called ahead to make sure my 3 dozen were packed up and even though I got there 5 minutes earlier than I expected, my order was ready and I was out the door in minutes!  Love it!  Can't wait to try the lunch foods I'm reading about.

21.description: Great spot south on Halsted. The food is simple yet fresh and reasonably priced. Outdoor seating too.

16.description: A friend recommended this place for our wedding cake! It's a small little spot on the south west side of town. I had emailed Monika  a couple of times prior to our tasting , this included discussing my cake a picture was sent etc. I had asked for a red velvet and chocolate cake. For our tasting we met with her,she was very pleasant and helpful! We tasted the cakes Which were good not the best but for the price we would be good! We had to remind her we wanted red velvet too, which wasn't brought out with the initial selection. Shen they brought it out. The cakes were not moist as we liked but very tasty! We settled for the chocolate with raspberry. A day before the wedding Monika called me saying i forgot the ribbon on my cake and  could I bring some in! I couldn't due to timing . On my wedding day my cake looked great, alittle wrong but no one but me would know. I was supposed to have a square base and 2 round tiers, I had 3 rounds. The flowers were not exactly the design I asked for, but close. The taste however was great ! The cake was moist and tasted great! After speaking to Monika she said I asked for the rounds, and it was a miscommunication ! I know what I ordered! So why the 4 stars! The cake tasted great! It looked great even though not exactly what I wanted and a supplemental ribbon was added on the cake! So would I recommend them yes the price for the 3 tier cake was $233. Which included delivery!  The same cake at about 3 other places costed $1000. For my next use and anyone else's use , I would say be extremely specific, make sure u have many pics of your cake design and if you like a moist cake or a dry  cake let them know!

17.description: This location is clean, warm and friendly.  The parking lot is key so you can stop by and make a quick trip in, find your favorite pastries and get back on the road asap and sneak back into work!  The BFM Staff is very nice and helpful.  Kudos!

10.description: I ordered 10 muffins and a fruit tray for an important meeting at work. With a one hour delivery window of 9:00-10:00am, they arrived at 10:30am! It was half way through the meeting, so everyone was too involved to take advantage of the food. Basically, it was a waste of money, and it made me look like I wasn't doing my job. However, the staff was able to eat the food and said it was delicious. So, two stars for the food. Regardless, I will never order from them again because as a first time customer, I now think they are completely unreliable.

11.description: I work nearby and am a frequent lunch customer. The staff is friendly and quick.  The food is great! They have fresh salads and daily sandwich specials - I really like the mozzarella & tomato sandwich.  All of their daily soups are delicious.

26.description: On weekend mornings, it is not uncommon for me to walk to Dunkin' Donuts to grab some donuts.  It's only half a block away from where I live, but I'd really rather go anywhere else if there was something closer.  Bake for Me is not closer, but a few mornings ago, I finally made the trek out there, and not only are their donuts infinitely better and fresher than Dunkin' Donuts', but they're actually cheaper.  If you are on the south side and need to get some donuts and coffee, this place is perfect.  I hear good things about their lunch options as well, but I can't personally attest to that.

27.description: Been wanting to stop here forever because I have heard so many good things about it and I love to support local businesses...  Glad I did!  The bakery selection had a large variety, the restaurant itself was very clean and nicely decorated, and the staff was very pleasant.  I ordered a bran muffin, a cinnamon roll, and a large cup of coffee.  (They were all huge). My bill was $4 and some change (you can't beat that!).  Everything was delicious and fresh.  I would definitely recommend and I plan on returning to sample their lunch menu.  So glad Canaryville has a nice little place like this!

0.description: This bakery is awesome!!I ordered a  1/2 sheet cake for my mother's birthday to be delivered. The cake was decorated gorgeous, the cake arrived right on time, and best of all that cake was delicious!!

20.description: Well, I looked high and low for a place to do a ultrasound  cake reveal and came across BFM. Jose was helpful at understanding what I asked for. A basic cake on the outside with a baby message onthe out side and blue or pink icing inside based on the sex of our baby that was phoned in by a coworker who was to keep it a secret form us the parents. He took the info,  had the cake ready on time and I sent my husband to pick it up... The cake reciept listed all of the above with the instruction of blue icing for boy on the reciept!!! My husband was just crushed that a small detail ike that was overlooked. He didn't tell me until after the reveal but when I called Jose that monday, he merely said thats their policy to attach the reciept and they don't get that invovled with party planning anyway, so it happened. WOW. Cake reveals have been around for 2 years now. I didn't want a free cake, he could have at least been empathetic and said Oh Im so sorry weve never really done this before, My apologies, would have been fine, but he was so "i don't care lady" so what.   I understand accidents happen but Geez! Just on the customer service follow up , they get 1 star.

19.description: On weekend mornings, it is not uncommon for me to walk to Dunkin' Donuts to grab some donuts.  It's only half a block away from where I live, but I'd really rather go anywhere else if there was something closer.  Bake for Me is not closer, but a few mornings ago, I finally made the trek out there, and not only are their donuts infinitely better and fresher than Dunkin' Donuts', but they're actually cheaper.  If you are on the south side and need to get some donuts and coffee, this place is perfect.  I hear good things about their lunch options as well, but I can't personally attest to that.

2.description: I just had to post an update to a previous review because I was overwhelmed by how much care goes into each cake. I ordered three cakes for my family Christmas dinner and they did not disappoint. The cakes were decorated beautifully and I can't wait to dig in on tomorrow.

18.description: Bake For Me made a cake for an anniversary party at work, and I was in the right place at the right time when it came to leftovers. :)  One side of the cake was chocolate layer cake with real banana cream in the center (slices of banana included!) and the other side had vanilla cake with strawberries in the center - all covered with white icing an big blue and yellow flowers. Absolutely delicious!

13.description: I've had numerous pastries as well as sandwiches and soup and they are always amazing. The coffee and espresso are also great. It is near my work and I was seriously upset when I was on maternity leave and couldn't go there on a weekly basis anymore. I have to talk myself out of going there more than one or twice a week.

4.description: Love this little bakery !! They have 99 cents a day old donuts and 3 of them Just 99 cents crazy!!!! They taste perfect.

24.description: Ordered a birthday cake for my boyfriend's birthday. I paid a little over $10 for delivery and requested it get to me by 9aThe driver called me from outside at 8:59. The cake was exactly as I ordered. they event added curled ribbon decoration which i didn't ask for. the cake was delicious and not too sweet as most  buttercream cakes can be. I was very impressed with the level of service and promptness..Wouldn't go anywhere else.

6.description: Great place for breakfast or lunch. Sandwiches are delicious, and their prices are very reasonable.

22.description: A friend recommended this place for our wedding cake! It's a small little spot on the south west side of town. I had emailed Monika  a couple of times prior to our tasting , this included discussing my cake a picture was sent etc. I had asked for a red velvet and chocolate cake. For our tasting we met with her,she was very pleasant and helpful! We tasted the cakes Which were good not the best but for the price we would be good! We had to remind her we wanted red velvet too, which wasn't brought out with the initial selection. Shen they brought it out. The cakes were not moist as we liked but very tasty! We settled for the chocolate with raspberry. A day before the wedding Monika called me saying i forgot the ribbon on my cake and  could I bring some in! I couldn't due to timing . On my wedding day my cake looked great, alittle wrong but no one but me would know. I was supposed to have a square base and 2 round tiers, I had 3 rounds. The flowers were not exactly the design I asked for, but close. The taste however was great ! The cake was moist and tasted great! After speaking to Monika she said I asked for the rounds, and it was a miscommunication ! I know what I ordered! So why the 4 stars! The cake tasted great! It looked great even though not exactly what I wanted and a supplemental ribbon was added on the cake! So would I recommend them yes the price for the 3 tier cake was $233. Which included delivery!  The same cake at about 3 other places costed $1000. For my next use and anyone else's use , I would say be extremely specific, make sure u have many pics of your cake design and if you like a moist cake or a dry  cake let them know!

15.description: I want to like this place but being a foodie causes me to expect a little bit more. The food is good and fresh but I am not a big fan. I was satisfied with my sandwich and soup, but that was it. I will give it another shot. We shall see.

7.description: Alright... :) my Gucci cupcakes look so darling! Thank you so much for creating a masterpiece for me. My friend will be so happy. Smells DELICIOUS!! FROSTINGVery Sweet...PRICEPrice was perfect for cupcakes!! 6 logo cupcakes, 6 regular cupcakes. ~$22.78Will definitely be back!

8.description: I work right near Bake for me and am a frequent lunch customer.  The employees here are very helpful and nice and it seems like a family atmosphere.  They have great specials every day on sandwiches...$6 for a panini or bacon avocado wrap.  I usually get the half soup/sandwich combo, which is a great deal for $6.50.  The soups are fantastic, I personally have tried all of them and love them all except the garden vegetable.  The chicken noodle and chicken tortilla soups are probably the best.  The chili is also very good.If you're on the pickier side you are able to make your own sandwich (pick the bread, meat, cheese, veggies, and dressing) and that's what I usually end up doing.  If you come here right at noon, expect a lunch rush but it's usually not too bad.

30.description: I hate to have to do this, really I do. I mean, there aren't many bakeries around me if I'm not in the mood for packzis. I was so excited to try this place out. I woke up early on a midweek day off, started a pot of coffee, and headed over in my pj's to get some sweets for my morning. The place was busy. A good sign right? The lines were moving quickly and the staff was super nice. I stood perusing the pastry case and finally settled on an almond croissant and a cheese slice. As I gave the gal my order, she told me it was buy one get one for the croissants. Sweet! I'll take the chocolate croissant as well. She bagged up my goodies and forked over $2.73. Man, this place just kept getting better and better. Free sweets and cheap?!? I'm in. I got home, poured a cup of coffee, and sat down to watch "Now, Voyager "(for the millionth time). Sat down with my cheese slice that looked so pretty, and dug in. bleh! The crust was rubbery. RUBBERY! How the hell does that happen in a bakery? In my kitchen, yes. In a bakery, hellz to the naw! The cream cheese filling was alright but the top layer was some weird, gelatinous, lemony stuff. Just ick! Strike one. On the the chocolate croissant. The pastry wasn't as light and buttery as I expect croissants to be and the chocolate wasn't very, well, indulgent. Kind of tasted like a melted Hersey bar. It wasn't bad - but wasn't as good as I had hoped. I ate it though, but that's because there's a fat girl trapped inside of me that's dying to get out. Strike two. Lastly, the almond croissant. By this time, I wasn't expecting much. I was pleasantly surprised. The pastry was flaky and buttery. The almond filling was rich and tasty, and the sliced almonds on top gave it a nice crunch. I will give this joint another try. I mean, they only got two strikes, so they're still in the game. This time I'll try lunch. Maybe that's their forte.

3.description: I didn't realize there were two locations. I have passed this one for many years. This is a nice little spot. They have sandwiches, breads, salads, cakes, muffins, danishes, coffee and other items. The prices and portions are really good. I bought a turkey, cranberry and walnut salad with a vinaigrette, an avocado and black bean salad, a raspberry and cheese croissant, a muffin and a slice of chocolate mousse cake. I spent $11.38. Not bad at all. I enjoyed everything but the chocolate cake. It didn't really do it for me.  It wasn't bad but it was a tad bit dry and not exactly my idea of chocolate mousse. I'll always try mousse when the opportunity arises but I'm pretty picky about it so it's okay. There is a seating area as well. It's a great place to stop by.

14.description: I'm in charge of ordering the birthday and special event desserts for my office that's located in the loop. This place is pretty good. We've never had any negative experiences, and only stray to other bakeries for variety and flavor. If anything, my co-workers claim that the frosting is too thick and too sweet. I'm not sure how that happens though. .

0.description: Uh-a cliche rinkie dink diner. Every time I have been there there has been a bunch of old men there watchin the news, drinkin coffee, etc. The service there is nearly non-existent.

12.description: I've been going to the local Fairplay Foods ever since it opened. It used to be really ghetto and trashy but now they maintain it very well. The prices are pretty good and the customer service is excellent.

3.description: Wow, wished I knew to come here a lot earlier. I think the store is pretty clean and well stocked.They have lots of selections and good prices. They have some great weekly sales.It can seem a bit sketchy, but I think it's not bad at all.

1.description: I have driven past this place for a long time and never stopped in until I went shopping for a lady I work for and yeah I agree with one poster that they need to mop in the meat area since there's no reason for the stench. Also the sketchiness of the store is questionable because it seems right when the new month happens it never fails to see a gang of hoodrats and their family members tying up every department mainly the meat and deli with their orders to feed their idiot boyfriends and disrespectful army of children. Also they need to get in touch with the way other stores run by having self checkout lines to make things go faster. Also when they give out samples they need to have a trash can because the floor was littered with half eaten chicken tenders and I got sick of stepping on that crap and instead of using toothpicks they used pretzel sticks to serve the chicken tender samples. They do however have some good weekly sales. Their chicken nuggets are about the only thing I have taken a liking to since they taste better than McDonalds and does not taste like minced chicken but the actual tenderloin of the chicken. Park your car several spots away the hood idiots can't park for crap like they failed driver's ed so they're not up against your car and boxing it in.

2.description: Hit or miss with this place, but the last time was defo a miss. I brought some bagels. The Dutch brand o_O. Praise your Gods that I checked the bagel before eating it. Complete mold on the bottom of the bagels. Why keep moldy food on the shelves. Corporate greed at it's finest.I wish more grocery stories would take the time to mop and clean around the meat area. Walking into a store and the first thing you smell is the stench of meat is a turn off. I mean, yes meat has a smell, but not the smell of meat and blood caked up on the floor for days on end smell. Naw can't do it. On a side note I wish more people would use VINEGAR to clean with...moving along. Also, I do not trust buying my meat from here. It taste strange at times and sometimes it can be so tough. This is why I have to stop eating meat. "It taste strange. It was tough." WTF type of life did this animal live and I am eating it.The produce department is not good at all. The few times I got in to this place, I can never buy produce because it's so bad. Either it's moldy, soft or there are flies everywhere. I do like this grocery store, because some of their items are discounted and those Doreen's mini-pizza's, Gingerbread Men and Yoplait Cherry and Pomegranate yogurt. I can't find them anywhere else, so I am forced to to trek here from time to time, but just be careful when you are shopping at this place, you are liable to get a couple of vaccinations with some of their products.SIDENOTE: Just wanted to add that this place does has many cab drivers if needed. Professional and non. Ask for Mr. G if you need a ride.

9.description: i can't quite give Fairplay four stars but it has inched it's way up from one to three in the matter of month of frequenting there.i migrated from a uber dutch town that was DRY as well as closed on Sundays. there was a Fairplay the next town over that we would go to for booze and for the sin of grocery shopping on Sundays. i strongly remember it smelling like rotting fish back then.i was warned by my neighbors, by my landlord "DONT GO TO FAIRPLAY....unless you absolutely are in dire need of something fast". coming here my first time i parked in between two cars: one blaring gospel music, the other gangsta rap... i'm not kidding - i couldn't even hear my phone ring it was so loud! there is a personal COP at the entry/exit: badge, gun, serious face, that scans every one that comes in the store - you must check your bags in as well upon entry. lastly cop cars (not just security, but CHICAGO COPS) circle the parking lot almost every time i go. just parking here i feel like i've entered a place of sin.... but now i just remind myself when i arrive the lyric from the lesbian duo "indigo girls" that "every devil i meet is an angel in disguise".and i dunno if its a corporate strategy to lure us with the smell of baiting rotted fish, but this Back of the Yards location smells EXACTLY the same as i remember from a different location in my childhood. enough to deter me from shopping here for 6 months despite being less than a mile away from my home. i would drive ALLLLL the way to south loop Whole Foods, Trader Joes, or Dominicks for groceries - which at times felt like a chore, especially if i only needed a few basic items. then i was in dire need of something.... i went from shopping here for emergency items, then just for the basics, now for almost anything packaged or most produce that can be found at any other grocery store. see my list of do's and don'ts for deets...I DO BUY HERE: 1) fresh produce: you may need to inspect some bunches but most has been good in my experiences. you can't beat the produce pricing here. they have cactus (not even some of the big three grocery stores have cactus), fresh ginger root, big bags of spinach, cilantro bundles for 50 cents (we eat cilantro every other day), good avocados... among many choices especially for vegetables2) packaged meat: the same packaged ground turkey, but for less money. more pounds of chicken packaged for significantly less money - just have to cut a lil more fat off in preparation. i don't eat pork and rarely eat beef so i can't vouch for those as i haven't purchased them from here yet.3) anything canned, jarred, or bottled: this place is canned goods king - almost every aisle has something canned in it (i know where to go when i want to stock my fall-out shelter). brand fruit juices for sometimes half the price of other stores or off-brand for even better pricing. 4) milk, eggs, packaged cheese: cheese is good and priced well but no variety besides standard packages of shredded cheeses. eggs and milk abundant, though not much variety and you MUST check the expiration date to get the most out a purchase!5) baked goods, bread and tortillas: fresh and inexpensive. i buy a large coffee cake to bring for breakfast and coffee at the rents for as low as $2.50! eat bakery breads soon or freeze as i don't think they have preservatives.  6) guilty snacks: they have this off brand flavored microwave popcorn for a dollar or two. i cannot refrain from putting it in my basket. i even bring it to my friends house and it's devoured in seconds. they have many brand name snacks for less or way cheaper alternatives. candy is way inexpensive - i just walk straight passed the aisle to resist! every once in awhile you can get a gallon of ice cream for under $3 if you spend over 20 dollars - i haven't said no to this deal and i still have ice cream sitting in my fridge.I DON"T BUY HERE:1) SEAFOOD & FISH: it's smells like rotting fish here... i can't help but steer clear of it2) over-the-counter meats: absolutely no deli. i'm sure some of the meat is OK over-the-counter but i don't trust the handling and the packaged meats suffice.3) cigarettes: well they don't sell them... and i just recently quit so i guess it doesn't matter now! 4) yogurt: the selection is almost non-existent. i must drive all the way to south loop grocery stores, or even settle for the almost non-existent selection of Halsted Foods selection of yogurt down the street.

10.description: This store is great if you like meat, like me, and, like me, don't like paying a hefty price for it! Seriously how can one pass up four pounds of bone in chicken breasts for four dollars and fourteen cents? I think you'd have to be out of your gourd to do that. This store is huge and you can find a lot of random things that you can't find at a Jewel They also have very decent prices.

4.description: I don't like coming here because the quality of the food and fresh vegetables can be dubious sometimes. The neighborhood itself is sketchy but it's handy when you need a last minute ingredient!

6.description: I just want to apologize for shopping here and for bothering the cashiers with my groceries. Everytime I shop here I feel as if I'm a bother. The employees are extremely rude. A few days ago I got yelled at by Gertie the cashier because apparently I had a job to do... I thought I was a customer? Besides, who likes feeling like they're in the ghetto anyway.

0.description: I prefer this grocery store among many other local options. There is plenty of parking and shopping carts available . What I love the most about this store is the  produce section. There is an abundance amount of fresh produce to choose from. I can always find a good deal on the produce or mostly anything.

5.description: Been here countless times since I was a kid. They have a well-stocked place for foods. Their shopping carts have locks that refuses to leave the parking lot though. There's also a fresh deli and hot food section here. Not recommended to stop by during busy days (end of the month or beginning of the month) when most do the restocking. This place is similar to Cermak Produce (minus a lot of the ethnic foods, they carry a lot of cheap groceries though) and carries a lot of the items for cheap.

13.description: The sales at fairplay are awesome!!!! The gentlemen in the the meat department (butchers) are very nice and professional and aim to please their customers, and the prices are reasonable

11.description: I recently moved to the area and I was on the hunt for finding a good neighborhood store. Fairplay is a good place to go for great deals.  You can find everything and anything in this store.  The meat is reasonably priced and specials on cereal and produce are competitive. Their bakery offers a great selection of cakes and pies.  There is even a "Day Old" clearance rack that offer fresh rye bread loaves for 50 cents!  I was in heaven! The produce is fresh and I see Whites, Blacks, Hispanics and Asians in this store.  That says a lot about the place because it offers something for EVERYONE!  The meat is good quality and every week there is a new sale.  Check it out!!

8.description: This supermarket is like a combination of all good things - the brand variety of Jewel/Dominick's combined with the bargains of ALDI, complete with a butcher, bakery, hot foods, deli counter and fishmonger.People from all walks of life can be found in the store, but it's located in Back of the Yards next to a dollar store and it's open all night on the last day of every month.Most of their weekly bargains (the ones noted in their weekly ads) can be found huddled together at the store entrance, but also in the regular aisles.  If you're in there and you're hunting for the milk, it's hidden in the corner in a little niche with some soda machines.  Just head all the way to the right as soon as you get in.You'll also probably find cuts of meat and pieces of animals that you've never seen before and might be shocked to know that people actually buy.  I now know where to look if I wake up one morning with a craving for pig's feet, turkey necks or hog jowls.  Or need a 40-pound box o' chicken parts.  Cuz they sell 'em there!Other awesome hidden spots - the aisle full of things you wouldn't believe could cost a dollar.  Take special note of the jars of preserved fruits and various boxed and canned foods - all costing $1 apiece.  Also, this is the corporate location and posibly the biggest, so they've got room to include different flavors of certain foods.  I never knew some of my favorite brands of barbecue sauce had so many different flavors!  And the chips as well!A word of advice: they try to check all bags/backpacks when you come in.  The first time I shopped here, I was almost hunted down by this guy because I had a backpack with me.  It all seemed fine, because I watched him clip a clothespin on my backpack and gave me the matching one, but at the end of my shopping trip - the guy was nowhere to be found.  If this happens to you, just go to the checkout on the far right that's also a counter - your bags are stored there and if the bag-check guy has disappeared (which he has over 70% of the time I've been there), the person working that checkout will get you your bag back.All in all, it's rare that I give a location a 5-star rating, but the fact that you can get there on the #47, #8 or #44 bus (the last of which swings right by my apartment) make this one of the easiest grocery chain stores for me to get to, and one of the cheapest I've ever been to as well!

14.description: This is a long standing grocery store chain in Chicago. Fairplay has good produce, great meats and low prices. This store is located in the Back of the Yards "hood" area, but I have never had problems here. Black, whites and hispanics shop here. Its not upscale like some stores, but your dollar lasts longer here than at other stores. I like Fairplay!

7.description: My mother insists on shopping here. Just a question...... Why are the cashiers here always so angry with my groceries??

12.description: I'd been hearing the reviews from a facebook food group so I decided to check them out. Parking is a little tight. We were greeted by an armed security guard that was friendly & inviting. The place was busy so that was a good sign. We browsed the menu & peeked in on the fried chicken they were boxing up for other customers. So we decided on shrimp & 8pc chicken. It was freshly dropped to order, so we waited about 10mins & our order was ready. Couldn't wait to get home to try it so we ate in the car. IT WAS DELICIOUS!!!!!! Smoking hot out the grease. We'll be back!

7.description: Awesome chicken, decent fish, you will wait for your order but why complain. It will always be fresh and hot. Glad i live close by , there is no where to eat there beside your car.

3.description: I went here about two weeks ago. And I'll never go again. I went thinking it was a black-owned business and it's not. Yes, that makes a difference as I'm trying to support this idea because I believe that black-owned businesses can increase stability in a neighborhood. Anyway, the management was rude, referring to me as "honey" "baby" and other sexist words. As a grown woman, I do not care for strange men to refer to me in such a manner. As I received my order, I got more patronizing comments such as " I got your back, baby". What did I need support for? When did picking up a bag of chicken become akin to "the struggle is real" slogan?!?! Also, the way the management talked to their employees was disgusting. Who wants to see folks being bossed around like they are dogs or arguing over  customers food? SMH. I'm not asking for Nirvana but how you treat others certainly says how you feel about people in general. The food was decent. The breading was a bit too dry, with too much black pepper. The okra was good. But the chicken wasn't too bad. Just average. I'll stick to my hometown favorite, Harold's.

1.description: The fried chicken here is ok. I'm kind of picky though. My favorite one in Chicago is The Roost which is located up north.The chicken here is kind of dry. It's not too greasy... So if it's you're cup of tea, I think you will really like it. The staff here is super nice though. They all seem to be proud of what they are a part of.

2.description: My hopes were high for an excellent fried chicken when I saw place on the map, especially when I travel to Louisiana frequent.  I ordered the 8 piece dark and literally waited 30 minutes for my chicken to be eaten, since they make every order fresh. Majority of the fried chicken consist of a heavy coat of batter with a spicy punch. After you tear past the heavy coat of batter, the chicken meat itself was bland. I can say that this is not a Louisiana fried chicken.

9.description: Worst customer service ever. I ordered the special and asked if it came with anything. The guy yells it says what it comes with on the poster. I then was told there were and will never be any biscuits. I also requested a side with my food and I was told all they had were fries. I looked at the menu and noticed they offered a lot of options. So I asked for mashed potatoes and the man yells I already gave you fries you should've said something. I hate nasty customer service it's the next best thing a restaurant can offer. The food is ok it's sort of spicy and it really doesn't have much flavor other than being spicy.

18.description: The chicken was VERY salty, the biscuit was DRY, the red beans & rice were NASTY. A waste of time and money.

10.description: Louisiana Fried Chicken was a restaurant that was referred to me by my older brother.  He complimented this establishment for their delicious fried chicken, so I had to find out for myself.I have to agree that Louisiana Fried Chicken has some of the best fried chicken that I have ever eaten!  The chicken is very juicy, crispy and not greasy at all.  The seasoning is excellent and makes my taste buds smile from ear to ear.  The wait time was was very short and the food very fresh and piping hot!  The cashier was very friendly and the restaurant was very clean.  They have a nice menu of other items and great side dishes to complement the entrees.  My brother was right for once, (wink) this restaurant does rock!  I will definitely come back and try some of their other items, on the menu, as well as have some more of that delicious fried chicken.I would definitely recommend this establishment with two thumbs up for the chicken and service.

13.description: I grew up in Los Angeles where Louisiana famous fried chicken originated and I was too happy to see one here. It has the same taste as the ones back home just need to find a way to keep the food hot for the ride home when you don't live across the street. Would love to have the option for the strawberry pop instead of the slushy as well. I will be back.

16.description: I'm so wanting this location of Louisiana Fried Chicken to be associated with the location that was a little past 127th and  Cicero?

17.description: the total lack of tables or counter space to even stand while eating will not deter me from enjoying the comestibles from here!  the jumbo shrimp was well-seasoned, maybe a little spicy for those with completely bland palates (sorry no offense!) the hush puppies were inhalable, too!  did not get any chicken on this visit but will fix that next time.  their packing boxes are retro-adorable.  the people behind the plexiglas wall were very nice, as were the other customers-in-waiting during our daytime sojourn.  I'm giving 5 stars but I would have preferred to take away 1/2 because I did think the prices were a little high or maybe I'm just getting really old and I'm used to cheaper food!

15.description: Jumbo shrimp? At a chicken joint? That was my first thought crossing my mind as I finally settled on what I was craving. But I figured why not,  I ordered the jumbo shrimp and chicken. The wait was short, service was great,  my food smelled so good my mouth watered before it got to my truck. I gotta say this is how chicken and shrimp should go together. I'll be back real soon.

0.description: This place is awesome!!!! It's as close to Louisiana deliciousness as I have found. The quality and accountability of the food and staff is absolutely phenomenal!!!! I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!

5.description: I think I was being kind giving two stars. I've driven past many times so I decided to pop in. Wrong stop.  The place looked clean and the the people were nice.  I thought the chicken was not good. It was nice and crispy but hated the seasoning. The fries weren't good and even the dinner role was nasty. Lol.

11.description: This is the 3rd time we've had chicken from here and each time it's been delicious.  We've even had it delivered before and it was piping hot.  I can say it's been consistent.  No complaints with service or the food.  I highly recommend it...

8.description: Yea, Grand opening! I been waiting for them to open for 4 months. They really turn this place to into a good looking carry-out restaurant. Will try them soon.Fried Chickens are fresh fried to order. Portion is bigger than Popeyes. I am not sure about their fried rice.

4.description: This is not a place where you want to eat.When I pulled up - I took pictures of the sign outside and posted that I thought this was what Heaven might look like.I ordered a five drumstick dinner with fried okra. The staff was super nice.The okara was perfect. The first drumstick was good - perhaps a bit bland. The second drumstick was like the first. The third drumstick was the beginning of the problem.The bottom of the bone was coated in a chalky jet-black residue. That one goes in the garbage.The fourth drumstick had black veiny business running up one side and down the other. That is number two for the garbage.The fifth drumstick (I should have just stopped trying and pitched the whole nasty affair into the trash bin.) was raw on the inside with deep reds and blood present. So I paid for five drumsticks and was able to eat two.I will never unsee that chalky black residue. It may ruin my friend chicken love forever. Probably not - but they are not worth the risk. Shame.

14.description: BEST FRIED CHICKEN I've ever had! The food is made fresh to order and the service is fantastic! The Chicken legs and jumbo fried shrimp was so juicy and delicious. I could eat the jumbo fried shrimp all day. The strawberry slushy is so flavorful and and clenched my thirst even on a rainy day . I would definitely come here again.

6.description: THE SECOND TIME AROUND Well after I posted my review on yelpI got a email the next day from Mr. Omar (manager ) he was very nice and asked me to give Louisiana chicken restaurant a second chance. Well being the very nice person that I am I said sure. And today was my big day.  I guess I had  Ms. yelper all over my face This man greeted me with a smile and a warm hand shake. I have to say I felt so good he had me ready to taste it all. I started off with a fresh cooked wing. I was like what a BIG different from the other day. And then I washed it down with a strawberry slush. He was so happy because I was happy. LolI was just in love with the fact that he was taking orders and greeting everyone and making sure I was now have a good time tasting the Gumbo.OMG it was so full of flavor and I had big shrimp on top. It's a winner for sure. To top it all off Mr. Omar sent me out the door smiling even more with my dinner for the night.So yes I'm very pleased to give this place all my stars and Thank youFor believing in a second chance
